update.description:
Inspired on the discussion on pull request #2492 and `ignition::common::SystemPaths::SetFindFile*Callback` functions.

I'm planning to use this with Ignition Fuel, currently working on branch `fuel_cache`.

The circular logic of `FindFile` and `FindFileURI` is not ideal, but I didn't want to touch it very much on this PR.
update.title: Support custom find file callbacks

content.raw: Sounds good, how about a future PR? :smile: :angel:
content.html: Sounds good, how about a future PR?

content.raw: do we want to add a function to remove / clear the `g_findFileCbsv` list? Not necessary, just a nice to have
content.html: do we want to add a function to remove / clear the g_findFileCbsv list? Not necessary, just a nice to have

content.raw: I like the idea of referencing issues too
content.html: I like the idea of referencing issues too

content.raw: Yes, if we support custom callbacks to find files, I think we shouldn't make assumptions about what schemes are supported or not.
content.html: Yes, if we support custom callbacks to find files, I think we shouldn't make assumptions about what schemes are supported or not.

content.raw:
I can’t load google’s style guide atm, but here’s what it says about todo comments `https://github.com/google/styleguide/blob/f9347e1e9d79aee9cde0802fe178d72c8f87926c/cppguide.html#L5172-L5210`

In short, it’s whoever is most familiar with the problem.
content.html:
I can’t load google’s style guide atm, but here’s what it says about todo comments https://github.com/google/styleguide/blob/f9347e1e9d79aee9cde0802fe178d72c8f87926c/cppguide.html#L5172-L5210

In short, it’s whoever is most familiar with the problem.

content.raw: Was this removed for a particular reason?
content.html: Was this removed for a particular reason?

content.raw:
You can ignore this comment. I forgot that this is on osrf/gazebo, which doesn’t use ign-cmake.

I think it’s meant to capture the person who is suppose to address the issue.
content.html:
You can ignore this comment. I forgot that this is on osrf/gazebo, which doesn’t use ign-cmake.

I think it’s meant to capture the person who is suppose to address the issue.

content.raw: Got it, is this the name of the person who put the todo, or the person who's supposed to address it?
content.html: Got it, is this the name of the person who put the todo, or the person who's supposed to address it?

content.raw: Change TODO to TODO\(somename\). Otherwise the new `make codecheck` will complain. I’ve been using “anyone” if one specific person is not appropriate.
content.html: Change TODO to TODO(somename). Otherwise the new make codecheck will complain. I’ve been using “anyone” if one specific person is not appropriate.
